abstract.p: Deals and Discounts column describes discount tour packages to Japan, discount package to Los Cabos in Mexico and Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts program called City Pleasures; drawing (M)

block.p: JAPAN PACKAGES -- Kintetsu International has two budget packages to Japan, one with Continental Airlines and one with Japan Airlines, that start at $1,040 and $1,100 respectively. The Continental Express package includes round-trip air fare from New York, four nights' standard-class hotel in Japan and either airport transfers in Tokyo or a half-day of sightseeing; the price is $1,040 through July 1, then $1,100 until Aug. 29. The Japan Airlines Express package includes similar features and costs $1,100 through June and $1,200 in July and August. Various options, like rail passes and extended stays, are possible. Kintetsu International, which has been selling travel from North America to Japan for 30 years, is a subsidiary of the Kinki Nippon Tourist Company of Tokyo. Information and reservations: (800) 225-5543 or www.kintetsu.com.

LOS CABOS DISCOUNT -- The Presidente Inter-Continental All-Inclusive Los Cabos in Mexico is offering a rate of $180 a night from July 15 through Sept. 30, a saving of almost 40 percent. The price includes meals, drinks, activities (including greens fees at the nine-hole San Jose golf course) and taxes for two people. At the edge of San Jose del Cabo on the Baja peninsula, the resort will have 390 rooms with the opening of a new wing July 1, four swimming pools, three lighted tennis courts, a fitness center, six restaurants and two snack bars. Reservations or information: (800) 327-0200.

TWO FOR ONE ON A BARGE -- B & V Waterways, which represents Continental Waterways, is offering a discount on the six-night sailing of Continental's 51-passenger barge Anacoluthe departing Aug. 12: two passengers can share a cabin for $1,990, ordinarily the price for one passenger. The itinerary runs between Bougival and Joigny on the Seine and the Yonne Rivers in the suburbs of Paris and in Burgundy. The rate covers meals with local wines and sightseeing, including a visit to Giverny. Air fare is extra. The cabins are all outside and air-conditioned. Contact B & V Waterways at (800) 217-4447; www.ewaterways.com.

PHONING IT IN -- With a program called City Pleasures, 29 Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts are offering guests this summer a $100 certificate good for meals, shopping at the hotel or a discount on the room bill. To receive the certificate, guests must mention City Pleasures when they make their reservation; present an A T & T Calling Card on check-in; stay two nights; and pay for their stay with an American Express card. Participating hotels include properties in Boston, Chicago, Dublin, Lisbon, Los Angeles, New York, Paris, Philadelphia, Seattle and Vancouver. Five hotels -- Atlanta, Cairo, Houston, Canary Wharf in London and Washington -- will double the amount of the certificate to $200. The program is good through Sept. 4. Reservations: (800) 332-3442.
